III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 2 bent Youth A’s arm back and hit the youth's face on the
ground resulting in a mark on the youth's face.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 5/19/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/22/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported he was redirecting
Youth A into his room due to him throwing water and other objects
in the hallway. Staff 1 reported Youth A made a joke that he was
going to back up into Staff 1 rather than walk forward so Staff 1
gently nudged him with his hand on his back towards the
bedroom. Staff 1 reported the movement with his right hand
placing it in the middle of Youth A's back and stated the
movement was a push towards the room. Staff 1 reported Youth A
had an accident in his pants earlier and left the soiled garments in
a garbage bag. Youth A joked like he was going to throw it at Staff
1 at which time Staff 1 asked him not to do that. Staff 1 reported
Youth A threw the garbage bag out of the window, breaking the
screen. Staff 1 reported he was attempting to reassure Youth A
that he was not in trouble for having an accident at which time
Youth A began throwing items in the room at him including the
remote to his RC car which hit Staff 1 in the chest. Staff 1 reported
while attempting to block the remote from hitting him, Youth A
attempted to run past him towards the door and Staff 1
instinctively grabbed Youth A’s left wrist with Staff 1’s right hand,
stopping him from going. Staff 1 reported Youth A pulled his wrist
away from him causing Youth A to lose his balance and fall
forward onto his face. Staff 1 reported he then helped Youth A up.
Staff 1 reported Staff 3 was nearby in the hallway at the time of
the incident. Staff 1 reported he got a write up due to being in the
room with Youth A with the door closed which is against facility
policy. Staff 1 reported he did not shut the door, stating that the
wind often blows the door closed and the window was open at the
time. Staff 1 denied knowing the door had closed during the
2

incident. Staff 1 denied observing any marks or bruises on Youth
A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/22/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A was observed to have
marks on his face at the time of the interview. Youth A had a
partially scabbed over circular mark between his eyes and a small
scrape on the tip of his nose. Youth A reported the marks were
from Staff 1 throwing him to the floor in his room. Youth A reported
he was trying to leave the room to go AWOL and go home when
Staff 1 grabbed his arm and shoved him to the floor where he hit
his face. Youth A reported that he did not fall to the ground, he
was pushed to the ground by Staff 1. Youth A reported no one
else was around when it occurred.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/22/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B reported that he smelled
poop and told Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth B reported Youth A was
upset and throwing stuff in the hallway and then went into his
room with Staff 1. Youth B reported he did not see what happened
in the room. Youth B reported Youth A’s face was scratched up
the next day. Youth B was not able to describe the scratches.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/22/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Youth C reported he was nearby
when Youth A became upset in the hallway after pooping himself.
Youth C reported Staff 1 was trying to get Youth A to take a
shower and went to Youth A’s room. Youth C denied seeing
anything further. Youth C also denied seeing marks on Youth A’s
face after that night. Youth C reported Youth A did have marks on
his face after falling from his bike approximately 3 weeks ago.
Youth C could not describe the marks from this or confirm if the
marks are still visible at this time.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/22/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 reported he was working the
night of the incident however did not see what occurred between
Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 denied having concerns with Staff 1
with how he intervenes with behaviors. Staff 2 denied observing
Staff 1 be physical with any youth. Staff 2 denied Youth A
disclosing anything to him regarding how he got any marks on his
face. Staff 2 could not recall if he had seen marks on Youth A’s
face recently.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/22/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported Youth A told her
3

that Staff 1 pushed him down. Staff 3 denied witnessing the event.
Staff 3 reported seeing marks on Youth A’s face the next day,
describing a scratch on his forehead and small scratches around
his nose. Staff 3 reported Youth A did fall from his bike a few
weeks prior, describing the marks from this incident to be
scratches on his cheek, his chin and his legs. Staff 3 denied
witnessing Staff 1 ever be inappropriate with any youth.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
5/22/2025 along with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor denied
working the night of the incident. Supervisor reported seeing
Youth A had a mark on his face at which time she asked Youth A
how he got the mark on his face. Supervisor reported Youth A
stated to her that Staff 1 pushed him down. Supervisor denied
having concerns with Staff 1 with regards to how he intervenes
with behavior or being physical with youth at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident Report (IR) dated 5/16/25 authored by Staff 1
details Staff 1 going into Youth A’s bedroom to address the
soiled garments at which time Youth A became upset,
punched out the window screen and tossed the bag of
garments out of the window. IR states that Youth A began
throwing objects in the room at Staff 1 and in response
Staff 1 told him he would receive a write up. IR states
Youth A attempted to move past Staff 1 at which time Staff
1 grabbed Youth A by the wrist. IR states that Staff 1
realized he cannot hold Youth A in the room so he quickly
let go, causing Youth A to lose his balance and fall to the
ground. IR notes that there were marks on Youth A’s face
prior to the incident and there were no new marks following
the incident.
• Employee Behavior and Discipline Report/Last Chance
Agreement dated 5/22/2025 issuing Staff 1 a 3-day
suspension for this incident citing it is alleged that his
actions caused physical injury to a youth. It is documented
that Staff 1 is shown on camera being in Youth A’s
bedroom with the door closed for approximately 2 minutes
which is against facility policy.
Video Reviewed:
• Video A footage dated 5/16/2025 shows the hallway
outside of Youth A’s bedroom. At 10 seconds in, Youth A
can be seen waving an open water bottle down the hallway
with Staff 1 approaching behind him. At 22 seconds Staff 1
4

is seen placing his right hand on Youth A’s back and
applying force to move Youth A into the bedroom.
• Video B footage dated 5/16/2025 shows the hallway
outside of Youth A’s bedroom following Staff 1 and Youth A
entering it. The door is closed. The door opens showing
Staff 1 emerge at approximately 24 seconds in, carrying
objects from the bedroom.
Analysis A violation is established regarding this allegation. Staff 1 can be
seen on video pushing Youth A with his right hand into his
bedroom which is not an appropriate intervention. Staff 1 and
Youth A reported that Staff 1 grabbed Youth A by the wrist which
is a prohibited intervention.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001696, CAP Approved 10/31/2024
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 2 was in Youth A’s bedroom with the door closed which is
against facility policy.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/22/2025
along with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported he received a write
up due to being in the room with Youth A with the door closed
which is against facility policy. Staff 1 reported he did not shut the
door, stating that the wind often blows the door closed and the
window was open at the time. Staff 1 denied knowing the door had
closed during the incident.
Documents Reviewed:
• Employee Behavior and Discipline Report/Last Chance
Agreement dated 5/22/2025 issuing Staff 1 a 3-day
suspension for this incident citing it is alleged that his
actions caused physical injury to a youth. It is documented
that Staff 1 is shown on camera being in Youth A’s
bedroom with the door closed for approximately 2 minutes
which is against facility policy.
5

Video Reviewed:
• Video B footage dated 5/16/2025 shows the hallway
outside of Youth A’s bedroom following Staff 1 and Youth A
entering it. The door is closed. The door opens showing
Staff 1 emerge at approximately 24 seconds in, carrying
objects from the bedroom.
Analysis A violation is established regarding this additional allegation. Per
facility policy, staff cannot be in a youth’s bedroom with the door
closed. Per Staff 1’s interview, video footage, and documented
disciplinary action, Staff 1 was in Youth A’s bedroom with the door
closed.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2025SIC0000096, CAP Approved 3/8/2025
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
